title: Old Man of Hoy Walking Route

images.title: Rackwick: Old Man this way by Chris Downer, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Rackwick, Old Man this way

images.title: Calum McRoberts / Footpath above Rackwick Bay
images.caption: Footpath above Rackwick Bay. This path which leads to the Old Man of Hoy looks to have been maintained very recently. The coastal views are spectacular towards the one time fishing community of Rackwick.

images.title: Rackwick: the coast path passes Too of the Head by Chris Downer, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Rackwick, the coast path passes Too of the Head

images.title: Rackwick: towards Rora Head by Chris Downer, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Rackwick, towards Rora Head

images.title: Paul Stephenson from London, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Old Man of Hoy, a classic Sea Stack on the Orkney Island of Hoy. Reached via a newly repaired path from Rackwick. 449 feet (137 m) high

images.title: The Old Man of Hoy by Colin Kinnear, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Old Man of Hoy

description: This walk takes you to the amazing 449-foot sea stack on the island of Hoy in the Orkney Islands. The walk begins from the Rackwick car park and follows a popular signposted footpath to the Old Man of Hoy. There are splendid views of the beautiful Rackwick Bay and of the surrounding countryside and hills on this varied walk.  Look out for peregrine falcons near the spectacular sea cliffs.
